b'Christians knows how to give.  Their lives are filled with generous acts \xe2\x80\x93 often hidden \xe2\x80\x93 towards their neighbour.'
b'Let us ask the Lord for this grace: that our hearts become free and filled with light, so that we can rejoice as children of God.'

b'\xed\x95\x9c\xea\xb5\xad\xec\x9d\x98 \xec\xb9\x9c\xea\xb5\xac\xeb\x93\xa4\xec\x9d\xb4\xec\x97\xac, \xea\xb3\xa0\xeb\xa7\x99\xec\x8a\xb5\xeb\x8b\x88\xeb\x8b\xa4. \xed\x95\x98\xeb\x8a\x90\xeb\x8b\x98\xec\x9d\x98 \xeb\x9c\xbb\xec\x97\x90 \xeb\x94\xb0\xeb\x9d\xbc \xec\xa0\x80\xeb\x8a\x94 \xea\xb3\xa7 \xec\x95\x84\xec\x8b\x9c\xec\x95\x84\xec\x97\x90 \xeb\x8b\xa4\xec\x8b\x9c \xec\x98\xac \xea\xb2\x83\xec\x9e\x85\xeb\x8b\x88\xeb\x8b\xa4.\n#Philippines #SriLanka'
b'Thank you, my friends in Korea. God willing, I will be back in Asia very soon. #Philippines #SriLanka'
b'So many innocent people have been driven from their homes in Iraq. Lord, we pray they may go back soon.'

b'\xec\x98\x88\xec\x88\x98\xeb\x8b\x98\xec\x9d\xb4 \xec\xa7\x80\xec\x8b\xa0 \xec\x8b\xad\xec\x9e\x90\xea\xb0\x80\xec\x9d\x98 \xed\x9e\x98\xec\x9d\x84 \xeb\xaf\xbf\xec\x9c\xbc\xec\x8b\xad\xec\x8b\x9c\xec\x98\xa4! \xec\x98\x88\xec\x88\x98\xeb\x8b\x98\xea\xbb\x98\xec\x84\x9c \xeb\xb3\xb4\xec\x97\xac\xec\xa3\xbc\xec\x8b\xa0 \xed\x99\x94\xed\x95\xb4\xec\x9d\x98 \xec\x9d\x80\xec\xb4\x9d\xec\x9d\x84 \xeb\xb0\x9b\xec\x95\x84 \xec\x9d\xb4\xec\x9b\x83\xea\xb3\xbc \xeb\x82\x98\xeb\x88\x84\xec\x8b\x9c\xea\xb8\xb0 \xeb\xb0\x94\xeb\x9e\x8d\xeb\x8b\x88\xeb\x8b\xa4.'
b'Trust in the power of Christ\xe2\x80\x99s Cross!  Receive his reconciling grace and share it!'
b'Lord, with so much violence in Iraq, may we persevere in our prayer and generosity.'

b'\xec\x9a\xb0\xeb\xa6\xac\xeb\x8a\x94 \xed\x95\x98\xeb\x8a\x90\xeb\x8b\x98\xec\x9d\x98 \xec\x9e\x90\xeb\xb9\x84\xeb\xa1\x9c \xea\xb5\xac\xec\x9b\x90\xeb\xb0\x9b\xec\x95\x98\xec\x8a\xb5\xeb\x8b\x88\xeb\x8b\xa4. \xec\x9d\xb4 \xea\xb8\xb0\xec\x81\x9c \xec\x86\x8c\xec\x8b\x9d\xec\x9d\x84 \xec\xa7\x80\xec\xb9\x98\xec\xa7\x80 \xeb\xa7\x90\xea\xb3\xa0 \xec\x98\xa8 \xec\x84\xb8\xec\x83\x81\xec\x97\x90 \xeb\x8b\xa4 \xed\x95\xa8\xea\xbb\x98 \xec\xa0\x84\xed\x95\xa9\xec\x8b\x9c\xeb\x8b\xa4.'
b'It is by God\xe2\x80\x99s mercy that we are saved. May we never tire of spreading this joyful message to the world.'

b'\xea\xb5\x90\xed\x9a\x8c\xea\xb0\x80 \xed\x95\x98\xeb\x8a\x90\xeb\x8b\x98\xec\x9d\x98 \xec\x82\xac\xeb\x9e\x91 \xec\x95\x88\xec\x97\x90\xec\x84\x9c \xeb\x8d\x94\xec\x9a\xb1 \xea\xb2\xbd\xea\xb1\xb4\xed\x95\x98\xea\xb3\xa0 \xeb\x82\xae\xec\x9d\x80 \xec\x9e\x90\xec\x84\xb8\xeb\xa1\x9c \xea\xb0\x80\xeb\x82\x9c\xed\x95\x9c \xec\x82\xac\xeb\x9e\x8c\xeb\x93\xa4\xea\xb3\xbc \xec\x99\xb8\xeb\xa1\xad\xea\xb3\xa0 \xeb\xb3\x91\xeb\x93\xa0\xec\x9e\x90\xeb\x93\xa4\xec\x9d\x84 \xec\x84\xac\xea\xb8\xb8 \xec\x88\x98 \xec\x9e\x88\xeb\x8f\x84\xeb\xa1\x9d \xea\xb8\xb0\xeb\x8f\x84\xed\x95\xa9\xec\x8b\x9c\xeb\x8b\xa4'
b'Let us pray that the Church be holier and more humble, loving God by serving the poor, the lonely and the sick.'
b'Let us not forget the cry of Christians and all vulnerable populations in Iraq.'

b'\xec\x88\x9c\xea\xb5\x90\xec\x9e\x90\xeb\x93\xa4\xec\x9d\x80 \xec\xa0\x80\xed\x9d\xac\xec\x97\x90\xea\xb2\x8c \xeb\xb6\x80\xec\x99\x80 \xeb\xaa\x85\xec\x84\xb1\xea\xb3\xbc \xec\x98\x81\xec\x98\x88\xeb\x8a\x94 \xec\xa4\x91\xec\x9a\x94\xed\x95\x98\xec\xa7\x80 \xec\x95\x8a\xeb\x8b\xa4\xea\xb3\xa0 \xea\xb0\x80\xeb\xa5\xb4\xec\xb9\x98\xea\xb3\xa0 \xec\x9e\x88\xec\x8a\xb5\xeb\x8b\x88\xeb\x8b\xa4. \xec\x98\x88\xec\x88\x98\xeb\x8b\x98\xec\x9d\xb4 \xec\x9c\xa0\xec\x9d\xbc\xed\x95\x98\xea\xb3\xa0 \xec\xa7\x84\xec\xa0\x95\xed\x95\x9c \xeb\xb3\xb4\xeb\xac\xbc\xec\x9e\x85\xeb\x8b\x88\xeb\x8b\xa4.'
b'The martyrs teach us that wealth, prestige and honor have little importance: Christ is the only true treasure.'
b'My heart bleeds especially when I think of the children in Iraq. May Mary, Our Mother, protect them.'

b'\xec\xb9\x9c\xec\x95\xa0\xed\x95\x98\xeb\x8a\x94 \xec\xa0\x8a\xec\x9d\x80\xec\x9d\xb4\xeb\x93\xa4\xec\x97\x90\xea\xb2\x8c, \xec\x98\x88\xec\x88\x98\xeb\x8b\x98\xec\x9d\x80 \xec\xa0\x80\xed\x9d\xac\xec\x97\x90\xea\xb2\x8c \xec\x9a\xb0\xeb\xa6\xac \xec\x82\xb6\xec\x97\x90\xec\x84\x9c \xec\xa0\x95\xeb\xa7\x90 \xec\xa4\x91\xec\x9a\x94\xed\x95\x9c \xea\xb2\x83\xeb\x93\xa4\xec\x9d\x84 \xeb\x86\x93\xec\xb9\x98\xec\xa7\x80 \xec\x95\x8a\xea\xb3\xa0 \xeb\xb3\xbc \xec\x88\x98 \xec\x9e\x88\xeb\x8f\x84\xeb\xa1\x9d \xed\x95\xad\xec\x83\x81 \xea\xb0\x81\xec\x84\xb1\xed\x95\x98\xea\xb3\xa0 \xea\xb9\xa8\xec\x96\xb4 \xec\x9e\x88\xec\x9c\xbc\xeb\x9d\xbc\xea\xb3\xa0 \xed\x95\x98\xec\x85\xa8\xec\x8a\xb5\xeb\x8b\x88\xeb\x8b\xa4.'
b'Dear young people, Christ asks you to be wide awake and alert, to see the things in life that really matter.'

b'\xec\xb2\x9c\xec\xa3\xbc\xec\x9d\x98 \xec\x84\xb1\xeb\xaa\xa8\xeb\xa7\x88\xeb\xa6\xac\xec\x95\x84\xeb\x8b\x98, \xec\xa0\x80\xed\x9d\xac\xea\xb0\x80 \xed\x95\x98\xeb\x8a\x90\xeb\x8b\x98\xec\x9d\x98 \xea\xb3\x84\xed\x9a\x8d\xec\x97\x90 \xeb\x94\xb0\xeb\x9d\xbc \xec\x84\xb8\xec\x83\x81\xec\x9d\x84 \xeb\xb0\x94\xea\xbf\x80 \xec\x88\x98 \xec\x9e\x88\xeb\x8f\x84\xeb\xa1\x9d \xeb\x8f\x84\xec\x99\x80\xec\xa3\xbc\xec\x8b\xad\xec\x8b\x9c\xec\x98\xa4.'
b'Mary, Queen of Heaven, help us to transform the world according to God\xe2\x80\x99s plan.'
b'Mary, Queen of Peace, help us to root out hatred and live in harmony.'

b'\xec\x84\xb1 \xec\x9a\x94\xed\x95\x9c \xeb\xb0\x94\xec\x98\xa4\xeb\xa1\x9c 2\xec\x84\xb8\xeb\x8b\x98, \xec\xa0\x80\xed\x9d\xac \xea\xb7\xb8\xeb\xa6\xac\xea\xb3\xa0 \xed\x8a\xb9\xeb\xb3\x84\xed\x9e\x88 \xec\xa0\x8a\xec\x9d\x80\xec\x9d\xb4\xeb\x93\xa4\xec\x9d\x84 \xec\x9c\x84\xed\x95\xb4 \xea\xb8\xb0\xeb\x8f\x84\xed\x95\xb4\xec\xa3\xbc\xec\x8b\xad\xec\x8b\x9c\xec\x98\xa4.'
b'Saint John Paul II, pray for us and especially for our youth.'

b'\xed\x95\x9c\xea\xb5\xad\xec\x97\x90 \xed\x95\x98\xeb\x8a\x90\xeb\x8b\x98\xec\x9d\x98 \xec\x9d\x80\xec\xb4\x9d\xec\x9d\xb4 \xed\x95\xa8\xea\xbb\x98 \xed\x95\x98\xec\x8b\x9c\xea\xb8\xb0\xeb\xa5\xbc - \xed\x8a\xb9\xeb\xb3\x84\xed\x9e\x88 \xeb\x85\xb8\xeb\x85\x84\xec\xb8\xb5\xea\xb3\xbc \xec\xa0\x8b\xec\x9d\x80\xec\x9d\xb4\xeb\x93\xa4\xec\x97\x90\xea\xb2\x8c.'
b'May God bless Korea \xe2\x80\x93 and in a special way, the elderly and the young people.'
b'I thank all those who are courageously helping our brothers and sisters in Iraq.'

b'\xed\x95\x9c\xea\xb5\xad\xec\x9c\xbc\xeb\xa1\x9c\xec\x9d\x98 \xec\x97\xac\xec\xa0\x95\xec\x9d\x84 \xec\x8b\x9c\xec\x9e\x91\xed\x95\x98\xeb\xa9\xb0, \xed\x95\x9c\xea\xb5\xad\xea\xb3\xbc \xec\x95\x84\xec\x8b\x9c\xec\x95\x84 \xec\xa0\x84\xec\x97\xad\xec\x9d\x84 \xec\x9c\x84\xed\x95\x9c \xec\xa0\x80\xec\x9d\x98 \xea\xb8\xb0\xeb\x8f\x84\xec\x97\x90 \xeb\x8f\x99\xec\xb0\xb8\xed\x95\xb4\xec\xa3\xbc\xec\x8b\x9c\xea\xb8\xb0\xeb\xa5\xbc \xeb\xb6\x80\xed\x83\x81\xeb\x93\x9c\xeb\xa6\xbd\xeb\x8b\x88\xeb\x8b\xa4.'
b'As I begin my trip, I ask you to join me in praying for Korea and for all of Asia.'
b'An appeal to all families: when you say your prayers, remember all those forced from their homes in Iraq. #PrayForPeace'
b'The news coming from Iraq pains me. Lord, teach us to live in solidarity with all those who suffer.'
b'Those driven from their homes in Iraq depend on us. I ask all to pray, and for those who are able, to give material assistance.'
b'Violence is not conquered by violence. Lord, send us the gift of peace. #prayforpeace'
b'I ask the international community to protect all those suffering violence in Iraq.'
b'I ask all Catholic parishes and communities to offer a special prayer this weekend for Iraqi Christians.'
b'Lord, we pray that  you sustain those who have been deprived of everything in Iraq. #prayforpeace'
b'Please take a moment today to pray for all those who have been forced from their homes in Iraq. #PrayForPeace'
b'I ask all men and women of goodwill to join me in praying for Iraqi Christians and all vulnerable populations.'
b'The Christian is someone who can decrease so that the Lord may increase, in his heart and in the heart of others.'
b'If you hoard material possessions, they will rob you of your soul.'
b'When we do not adore God, we adore something else.  Money and power are false idols which often take the place of God.'
b'May each family rediscover family prayer, which helps to bring about mutual understanding and forgiveness.'
b'May we be always more grateful for the help of domestic workers and caregivers; theirs is a precious service.'
b'When one lives attached to money, pride or power, it is impossible to be truly happy.'
b'The great threat in today\xe2\x80\x99s world is the loneliness of hearts oppressed by greed.'
b'The Lord loves a cheerful giver.  May we learn to be generous in giving, free from the love of material possessions.'
b'The Church, by her nature, is missionary. She exists so that every man and woman may encounter Jesus.'
b'Dear young people, do not be mediocre; the Christian life challenges us with great ideals.'
b'The World Cup allowed people from different countries and religions to come together. May sport always promote the culture of encounter.'
b'Do not be afraid to cast yourselves into the arms of God; whatever he asks of you, he will repay a hundredfold.'
b'With God, nothing is lost; but without him, everything is lost.'
b'Dear young people, do not give up your dreams of a more just world!'
b'To live as true children of God means to love our neighbour and to be close to those who are lonely and in difficulty.'
b'Jesus, help us to love God as Father and our neighbour as ourselves.'
b'May Saints Peter and Paul bless the city of Rome and the entire pilgrim Church throughout the world.'
b'To be friends with God means to pray with simplicity, like children talking to their parents.'
b'In the face of life\xe2\x80\x99s difficulties, let us ask the Lord for the strength to remain joyful witnesses to our faith.'
b'The family is essential to sustaining human and social development.'
b'How I wish everyone had decent work!  It is essential for human dignity.'
b'Let us pray for the Christian communities in the Middle East, that they may continue to live in the land where Christianity was born.'
b'There is so much indifference in the face of suffering.  May we overcome indifference with concrete acts of charity.'
b'There is never a reason to lose hope.  Jesus says: \xe2\x80\x9cI am with you until the end of the world\xe2\x80\x9d.'
b'Sometimes we cast the elderly aside, but they are a precious treasure: to cast them aside is an injustice and an irreparable loss.'
b'May the Lord bless the family and strengthen it in this moment of crisis.'
b'We run the risk of forgetting the suffering which doesn\xe2\x80\x99t affect us personally.  May we respond to it, and may we pray for peace in Syria.'
b'May we not resist the Holy Spirit but allow him to work in our lives, so that he can renew us, the Church and the world.'
b'I wish everyone a wonderful World Cup, played in a spirit of true fraternity.'
b'Let us pray for all victims of sexual violence in conflict, and those working to end this crime. #TimeToAct'
b'May we never talk about others behind their backs, but speak to them openly about what we think.'
b'I ask all people of good will to join us today in praying for peace in the Middle East. #weprayforpeace'
b'Prayer is all-powerful. Let us use it to bring peace to the Middle East and peace to the world. #weprayforpeace'
b'Peace is a gift of God, but requires our efforts. Let us be people of peace in prayer and deed. #weprayforpeace'
b'Like the Good Samaritan, may we not be ashamed of touching the wounds of those who suffer, but try to heal them with concrete acts of love.'
b'Thank you to all teachers: educating is an important mission, which draws young people to what is good, beautiful and true.'
b'At times we can be self-absorbed.  Lord, help us to open our hearts to others and to serve those who are most vulnerable.'
b'In the difficult moments of life, Christians can turn to the Mother of God and find protection and care.'
b'Every Christian can witness to God in the workplace, not only with words, but above all with an honest life.'
b'May we enter into true friendship with Jesus, so that following him closely, we may live with and for him.'
b'Dear friends, please pray for me during my pilgrimage to the Holy Land.'
b'To live by faith means to put our lives in the hands of God, especially in our most difficult moments.'
b'We will never be disillusioned or lose our way if we are guided by God.'
b'I ask all of you to pray for the victims of the floods in Bosnia and Herzegovina, in Serbia and in other countries in the region.'
b'Come, Holy Spirit!  Help us to overcome our selfishness.'
b'The one who listens attentively to the Word of God and truly prays, always asks the Lord: what is your will for me?'
b'The month of May, dedicated to Mary, is a fitting time to begin to recite the rosary daily.'
b'Our mission as Christians is to conform ourselves evermore to Jesus as the model of our lives.'
b'Let us ask the Holy Spirit for the grace to live daily according to the mind of Jesus and his Gospel.'
b'Let us pray for the miners who died in Turkey and for the latest victims of shipwreck in the Mediterranean.'
b'Let us read the Gospel, a small section each day. This way we will learn what is most essential in our lives: love and mercy.'
b'Our life has been saved by the blood of Christ. Let us always be renewed by this love.'
b'Let us all join in prayer for the immediate release of the schoolgirls kidnapped in Nigeria.\n#BringBackOurGirls'
b'A family enlightened by the Gospel provides a school for Christian living! There one learns faithfulness, patience and sacrifice.'
b'Holiness means giving ourselves in sacrifice every day. And so married life is a tremendous path to sanctity!'
b'In our families we learn to love and to recognise the dignity of all, especially of the elderly.'
b'A society which abandons children and the elderly severs its roots and darkens its future.'
b'What does \xe2\x80\x9cevangelise\xe2\x80\x9d mean? To give witness with joy and simplicity to what we are and what we believe in.'
b'Do not be afraid! Open the doors to Christ!'
b'No one is more patient than God the Father; no one understands and knows how to wait as much as he does.'
b'I ask everyone with political responsibility to remember two things: human dignity and the common good.'
b'Who among us can presume to be free of sin?  No one. Let us ask God to forgive our sins.'
b'Inequality is the root of social evil.'
b'None of us can think we are exempt from concern for the poor and for social justice (EG 201).'
b'We must not let ourselves fall into the vortex of pessimism. Faith can move mountains!'
b'A simple lifestyle is good for us,  helping us to better share with those in need.'
b'Each encounter with Jesus fills us with joy, with that deep joy which only God can give.'
b'Christ is risen!  Alleluia!'
b'Please join me in praying for the victims of the ferry disaster in Korea and their families'
b'It is not easy to follow Jesus closely, because the path he chooses is the way of the Cross.'
b'Each encounter with Jesus changes our life.'
b'Holy Week is a good occasion to go to confession and to take up the right path again.'
b'How beautiful it is to stand before the Crucifix, simply to be under the Lord\xe2\x80\x99s gaze, so full of love. (EG 264)'
b'Only trust in God can transform doubts into certainty, evil into good, night into radiant dawn.'
b'Jesus teaches us to not be ashamed of touching human misery, of touching his flesh in our brothers and sisters who suffer. (EG 270)'
b'We need to rediscover a contemplative spirit, so that the love of God may warm our hearts.'
b'How good it is for us when the Lord unsettles our lukewarm and superficial lives.'
b'In the Gospel we can hear Jesus speaking to us every day: may we always carry with us a small copy of the Gospel!'
b'With Jesus our life becomes full. With him everything makes sense. (EG 266)'
b'May we never get used to the poverty and decay around us. A Christian must act.'
b'Dear parents, teach your children to pray. Pray with them.'
b'Lent is a time to change direction, to respond to the reality of evil and poverty.'
b'We live in a society that leaves no room for God; day by day this numbs our hearts.'
b'We all need to improve, to change for the better. Lent helps us fight against our faults.'
b'Lent is a time of grace, a time to convert and live out our baptism fully.'
b'We cannot be tepid disciples.  The Church needs our courage in order to give witness to truth.'
b'Jesus is never far from us sinners.  He wants to pour out on us, without limit, all of his mercy.'
b'Jesus is our hope.  Nothing \xe2\x80\x93 not even evil or death \xe2\x80\x93 is able to separate us from the saving power of his love.'
b'Sickness and death are not taboo subjects.  They are realities that we must face in Jesus\xe2\x80\x99 presence.'
b'May we learn to say \xe2\x80\x9cthank you\xe2\x80\x9d to God and to one another.  We teach children to do it, and then we forget to do it ourselves!'
b'I greet the World School Network for Encounter. \nToday we plant the first virtual olive tree for peace. @infoscholas'
b'Christian love is loving without counting the cost.  This is the lesson of the Good Samaritan; this is the lesson of Jesus.'
b'Thank you for all your warm wishes on my anniversary. Please continue praying for me.'
b'Please pray for me.'
b'The challenge for Christian spouses:remaining together, knowing how to love one another always, and doing so in a way that their love grows.'
b'Our deepest joy comes from Christ: remaining with him, walking with him, being his disciples.'
b'Let us pray for Christians who are victims of persecution, so that they may know how to respond to evil with good.'
b'Lent is a good time for sacrificing.  Let us deny ourselves something every day to help others.'
b'In life we all make many mistakes. Let us learn to recognize our errors and ask forgiveness.'
b'How to live a good marriage? United to the Lord, who always renews our love and strengthens it to overcome every difficulty.'
b'Let us thank all those who teach in Catholic schools. Educating is an act of love; it is like giving life.'
b'The Eucharist is essential for us: it is Christ who wishes to enter our lives and fill us with his grace.'
b'In a family it is normal to take charge of those who need help. Do not be afraid of frailty!'
b'All of us who are baptized are missionary disciples. We are called to become a living Gospel in the world.'
b'Our Lady is always close to us, especially when we feel the weight of life with all its problems.'
b'Let us never lose hope! God loves us always, even with our mistakes and sins.'
b'Confirmation is important for Christians; it strengthens us to defend the faith and to spread the Gospel courageously.'
b'Lord Jesus, make us capable of loving as you love.'
b'Let us learn from Christ how to pray, to forgive, to sow peace, and to be near those in need.'
b'To all who are sick, do not lose hope, especially when your suffering is at its worst.  Christ is near you.'
b'Let us pray for peace in Africa, especially in the Central African Republic and in South Sudan. #prayforpeace'
b'Dear young people, don\xe2\x80\x99t be afraid to marry.  A faithful and fruitful marriage will bring you happiness.'
b'Let us pray for seminarians, that they may listen to the voice of the Lord and follow it with courage and joy.'
b'I greet all those who are sick and suffering.  Christ Crucified is with you; cling to him!'
b'Today I ask you to join me in prayer for His Holiness Benedict XVI, a man of great courage and humility.'
b'Let us pray for all good and faithful priests who dedicate themselves to their people with generosity and unknown sacrifices.'
b'The Sacraments, especially Confession and the Eucharist, are privileged places of encountering Christ.'
b'What zest life acquires when we allow ourselves to be filled by the love of God!'
b'The world makes us look towards ourselves, our possessions, our desires.The Gospel invites us to be open to others, to share with the poor.'
b'Dear young people, Jesus gives us life, life in abundance. If we are close to him we will have joy in our hearts and a smile on our face.'
b'It is important to have friends we can trust. But it is essential to trust the Lord, who never lets us down.'
b'May the World Day of Consecrated Life be a timely occasion to rediscover the centrality of Jesus in our lives.'
b'Sometimes we are saddened by the weight of our sins. May we not be discouraged. Christ has come to lift this burden and give us peace.'
b'No one saves oneself. The community is essential.'
